conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by four objects with a moving light source.
There are four objects labeled A, B, C, and D, each casting a shadow on the ground.
Object A is a cluster of mushrooms with different sizes.
Object B looks like a piece of cloth or a rag.
Object C is a white dress.
Object D is a book titled '3640'.
The light source is moving forward above the objects.
Position of the shadow depends on the position of the object and the direction of the light source.
Size of the shadow depends on the distance between the object and the light source, as well as the angle of the light.
When the light source moves closer to the object, the shadow becomes larger, and when it moves away, the shadow becomes smaller.
Direction of the shadow changes based on the direction of the light.

premise: Light source moves forward above the objects.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift backward.

premise: Light source moves forward above the objects.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become shorter and smaller.
